result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron Dale Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Myron Dale Cloud is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Myron Dale Cloud was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 10/13/22
- 5 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: - $250.00 Fine, payable through DOC as a condition of probation in case 22CF425.
- $250.00 DNA Surcharge, payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in case 22CF425

timeConds.notes:
- Huber and EHM Eligible
- Defendant can serve in Sawyer County Jail if arrangements can be coordinated at no cost to St. Croix County Jail
- Defendant to report and commence jail sentence within 60 days

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron Dale Cloud

records.addlTxt: e: DA, Atty Satorius, and DOC    c: DE and SCSO   email: Jail.
e: DOC. arc

8:19 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Myron Dale Cloud in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Myron Dale Cloud.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF425, 22TR1848, 22TR1849, 22TR1850, 22TR1851, & 22TR1852. Atty Satorius states there is an agreement, recites joint recommendation stating all TR matters will be dismissed.  ADA Becker agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer in 22CF425.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF425. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 22CF425 and also 22TR1848, 22TR1849, 22TR1850, 22TR1851, & 22TR1852.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF425

S/W 2 Years Probation

- F/F of $500 inclusive of costs
 Apply Bond.

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- AODA and follow through 
- Absolute sobriety
- 6 months County Jail.  Huber and EHM eligible.  DE can serve in Sawyer county jail if arrangements can be coordinated at no cost to SCC Jail.  DE to report and commence jail sentence within the next 60 days. 
- Sign up for probation today, 10/13/22

5 days credit against ultimate sentence.

9:14 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Myron Dale Cloud in court.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Myron Dale Cloud. Includes 22CF425 (PH), 22TR1848, 22TR1849, 22TR1850, 22TR1851, & 22TR1852- all TR's set for STC.  ADA Ellenwood states CF will be a waiver of PH and move to ARGN. On 22CF425- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Satorius states they would like to proceed to ARGN, per the State, the information will mirror the complaint.  Court proceeds to ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG please entered on all cases.  If next hearing is scheduling only, DE can appear by zoom.
